intro: Galium bovei var. hesperium, commonly known as the western bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, oval to elliptic in shape, and covered with fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
